description.narrative: Civil Rights Defenders föreslår att arbeta genom en koncentrerad insats med både etablerade och nya och framtida mänskliga rättighetsorganisationer och HRD i Etiopien -- för att stärka kapaciteten för denna avgörande civilsamhällsgrupp under den fortsatta demokratiska övergången, före, under och bortom de planerade nationella valen.

Civil Rights Defenders proposes to work through a concentrated effort with both established and new and up-­-coming human rights organizations and HRDs in Ethiopia -­- to strengthen the capacity of this crucial civil society group throughout the continued democratic transition, before, during and beyond the planned national elections.

The main objective of this intervention is to revitalize and strengthen human rights organizations and human rights defenders in Ethiopia through participatory-driven capacity collaboration and strengthening.
The main objective will be reached through four main components;
1. Detailed organizational assessments - Identification and selection process of participating human rights organizations/actors
Component activities: (i) Identification and selection process of project organizations/actors and (ii) In-Depth organizational assessments of capacity needs/gaps to be addressed through project activities.
Component expected results:(i) Approximately 8-10 human rights organizations/networks identified and selected for capacity collaboration and strengthening, and (ii) Organizational assessment reports per each participating organizations.
2. Financial and administrative capacity strengthening through tailored organizational financial management and administrative support.
Component activities: (i) Super audits conducted with selected, established or semi established human rights organizations, (ii) Financial and administration audits conducted by Civil Rights Defenders with new human rights organizations/networks, (iii) Follow-up and mentoring on developed financial management implementation plans - including ensuring alignment with other donor requirements, for example the UN, the EU and the CSSP funding mechanism, and (iv) project based small sub granting programming with one grant per selected human rights organization.
Component expected results: (i) Participating human rights organizations/actor with organizational capacity to access longer term financing by regional and international donor institutions, (ii) Sub granting project results related to human rights in Ethiopia.
3. Security capacity strengthening
Component activities: (i) Physical and psychosocial security training conducted in country or in a third country depending on the security situation at the time of training, (ii) Digital security training and digital security mentoring program for participating organizations.
Component expected results:(i) A human rights community in Ethiopia equipped with knowledge, skills and techniques to handle relevant security threats both with regards to physical, psychosocial and digital security.
4. Human rights advocacy and networks expansion
Component activities:(i) National joint capacity building event focused on joint capacity strengthening and sharing, including collaboration with donor institutions, (ii) Regional capacity building workshop with the National Coalition for Human Rights Defenders in Kenya, (iii) Ethiopia partners participation in Defenders Days 2020, including international policy and advocacy meetings, (iv) Defenders Database training, implementation and mentoring, and (v) Joint report on the state of Human Rights in Ethiopia.
Component expected results:(i) Strengthened national collaboration on national, regional and international advocacy on human rights in Ethiopia through increased networking on all three levels, (ii) Joint advocacy report in human rights situation and priorities in Ethiopia based on data collected, stored and reported upon through the Defenders Database.

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Examples of results acheived: - 11 CSOs across Ethiopia with strengthened organisational capacities, including strategies, policies, communication tools, security routines and improved reporting and able to monitor human rights. - Recently established CSOs networking in human rights monitoring and advocacy with the more established human rights organisations, improving their reach.
Due to the war the project has not been able to work with CSOs in Tigray.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
